message_1: What is the truth value of the proposition "If p and q are both true, then p or q is true" when p = 0 and q = 1?
message_2: In this case, p = 0 (false) and q = 1 (true). The proposition states "If p and q are both true, then p or q is true." Since p is false and q is true, the condition "p and q are both true" is not satisfied. Therefore, the proposition is considered vacuously true, as the condition for the implication is not met. The truth value of the proposition is true.
